channel.title: Tough Virus
channel.description:
I'm trying to help out my brother here. Normally I'm good at these kinds of things but this virus is insane. Won't allow itself to be moved, editted, or anything. No .exe programs will open.
A system restore did nothing.
A lot of people suggest regedit but that can't open because its a program.
This is what it says when you try to open a .exe "Windows cannot access the specified device, path, or file. You may not have the appropriate permissions to access the item."
Please let me know of a solution if you can think of one and I will try it. Thanks

item.title: Tough Virus
item.dc:creator: @rant rant
item.description:
@rant wrote:

[quote=“Marine5287, post:17, topic:400136”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=497226.msg3636270#msg3636270 date=1308616670]

i’ve removed a cycbot before, and a few other hackmods and trojans. You may just want to re-install your operating system

Fixed it everyone. Thanks.

[/quote]just because the affects of a virus are gone, doesn’t mean it’s completely gone.
everything leaves a trace.

That’s why it’s best to clean your computer, or re-format.[/quote]
i completely cleaned the virus, and yes that is an effective way

Read full topic

item.title: Tough Virus
item.dc:creator: @Marine5287 Marine5287
item.description:
@Marine5287 wrote:

You can go to start then search, “Recovery”, then open it up. Now click advanced recovery methods and then click, "return your

computer to factory condition". Works every time.

Read full topic

item.title: Tough Virus
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

pk2play:

Welll… How did you fix it?

Not 100% sure actually. My brother managed to get internet explorer opened and I installed anti-maleware bytes as an administrator and it allowed it to open and I could then run a scan which removed the virus

Read full topic

item.title: Tough Virus
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I, post:1, topic:400139”]http://www.kellys-korner-xp.com/regs_edits/exefix.reg
download that, and try running it to fix the executable files in the registry.

if it doesn’t allow you to add it to the registry, do the following:

Press CTRL-ALT-DEL and open Task Manager. Once there, click File, then hold down the CTRL key and click New Task (Run). This will open a Command Prompt window. Enter REGEDIT.exe and press Enter. Once regedit is open click File>Import and locate that reg file fix, highlight it and click Open.

if he can’t access the internet, use a floppy, cd, or zip disk to transfer the registry file over.

after it’s added to the registry, restart the system.[/quote]

Can’t open REGEDIT.exe but I can try xfering the file over. Would I still be able to add it by just running it?

Read full topic

item.title: Tough Virus
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

When I had a virus like what you explained, this is what I did.
Safe Mode, logged into that as administrator, and then I noticed that my main computer account had lost admin rights, so I re-enabled and was able to remove the virus.

Read full topic

item.title: Tough Virus
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

Try Safe Mode with networking - repeatedly tap F8 as you boot up.

Then try running the programs.

If not, backup important files, format PC.

Try opening task manager and ending any .exe’s that’s not labeled “system”.

Read full topic

item.description:

I guess the only option would be to reïnstall windows. If that doesn’t work you’re pretty much fucked.

Read full topic
